infos.title: SysON
infos.description:
SysON is a web-based environment to graphically edit SysML v2 models.

SysON’s objective is to provide System Engineers with super easy access to this new standard, at minimal cost and great ease of use, with the guarantee of interoperability with other open-source MBSE tools.

infos.title: Papyrus
infos.description: Papyrus web version provides UML graphical editors.

infos.title: Obeo SmartEA
infos.description:
Obeo SmartEA® is a graphical and collaborative Continuous Enterprise Architecture solution enabling you to map your organization and its IT system.

It provides web-based graphical editors for ArchiMate and BPMN models.

infos.title: Ground and Space Segment Engineering Framework (GSEF v3)
infos.description:
Funded by funded by the European Space Agency, GSEF is an open and collaborative web platform that supports a model-based approach to modernize and streamline the engineering of ground segments for space missions.

GSEF v3 integrates SysON to provide the core support for SysML v2 in a web-based environment. It extends SysON to add custom graphical editors to represent SysML v2 elements with domain-specific colors and shapes and new tools to support specific tasks (for example, validation, queries, editing workflows, method guidance).

infos.title: Pepper
infos.description:
Pepper models the core elements of R&D project management. It goes far beyond task tracking by introducing a rich set of interrelated concepts to represent projects, deliverables, goals, risks, and collaboration structures.

Pepper offers a set of tailored, interactive web views to support various project activities, from long-term planning to daily task management: Form, Gantt, OKR, Daily, Kanban.

infos.title: EasyMOD
infos.description:
EasyMOD is a collaborative project led by IRT Saint Exupéry supported by the European Space Agency (ESA), Airbus Defence and Space, Airbus Commercial Aircraft, HDGroup, and the French Government.

It introduced innovative solutions for consistently reviewing heterogeneous MBSE models across multiple structural analyses, including Product Breakdown Structure, Functional Breakdown Structure and Functional Flows.

During this project an extension to SysON was developed to implement a dedicated methodology for reviewing systems engineering data, including dedicated diagram editors for SEIM (Systems Engineering Information Model) concepts and Helper tools to guide systems engineers throughout the review process.

infos.title: Arcadia
infos.description: This experimental extension of SysON provides web-based editors to author SysML v2 models according to the Arcadia methodology.

infos.title: Flow
infos.description:
This demo is a sample studio to design electronics components.

It is used by Obeo to showcase how to create a modeling tool with Sirius Web.

infos.title: Value Chain Analysis and Design
infos.description: This project aimed at implementing a prototype of the ITEA value-chain notation. Our goal was to support live collaborative modeling and flexible modeling suitable for R&D and collaborative projects planning.

medias.imgAlt: A probabilistic model of how long it takes to get to work.

infos.title: Guesstimate
infos.description: This prototype is a Sirius Web domain-specific tool inspired by Guesstimate, built to do probability modeling and run Monte Carlo simulations to answer everyday estimation questions (like “how long will it take to make coffee?”) while keeping the implementation intentionally small. The domain logic lives in an EMF-based metamodel plus a compact Java implementation (about 11 files and ~1,028 non-generated lines of code), and the UI showcases Sirius Web features such as the charts widget in the details view, with easy integration of standard Java libraries like Apache Commons Math and PetitParser.
